This game is a journey in suffering and self-discovery. I've often found myself struggling to explain the premise of the game to people, especially in regards to the killer. Why would you want to play a killer? One whose purpose is to force people to suffer and ultimately die?

The irony and simplicity of how you can do this was not lost on the developers, and in fact works quite well. Simply put, you become a killer because you tire of playing survivor. The game is largely based on teamwork, and as such, your teammates will inevitably let you down. Slowly, but surely, your patience will wear thin, until, at least, you become the thing you dread...and swap to killer.

And it will feel good.

Buy this now.

Letherface = killer camp

Edit: This game has become unfunny since adding 615641 new killers. I miss 72hrs era, when looping was a thing and there wasn't a dude with literally a gun. I'm probably never turning it on again. Thank you for being the most entertaining game for a very long time.
Fellow survivors are the true killers here
It's a scary game, but I like it
Still the one game i love.
Dead by Daylight is certainly a tough game, but with friends it's an amazing team based horror game!

It's a fantastic game for the first 200 hours. Everything is uber and wonderful, but since it's a pvp game the toxicity is bound to come out and eat at you. Whether you like the game enough to endure it or not is another thing, but if you think 200 hours for this price is ok then I'd highly recommend it. I would also recommend playing survivor with friends for another whole new experience when you get tired of the solo queue life. It's an entirely different feeling.
